packageMeta.name: purescript-zipperarray
packageMeta.description: A non-empty array with one element focused.

declarations.comments:
A `ZipperArray` is represented by a `NonEmptyArray`, an index into the
array, and the element at that index. The constructor is kept private so
that correctness guarantees can be ensured (as long as all the functions
are correct).
declarations.title: ZipperArray

declarations.comments:
If the focused item is the one that was deleted, this policy describes which
adjacent item should be focused (if possible).
declarations.title: DeleteFocusedItemFocusBumpPolicy

declarations.comments:
Constructs a ZipperArray from a single item. The current item of the
resultant ZipperArray is the given item.
declarations.title: singleton

declarations.comments:
Constructs a ZipperArray from an array of items. Returns Nothing if the
array is empty. Focuses the first item.
declarations.title: fromArray

declarations.comments: Constructs a ZipperArray from a `NonEmptyArray`. Focuses the first item.
declarations.title: fromNonEmptyArray

declarations.comments: Returns a ZipperArray containing just the current item.
declarations.title: toCurrentSingleton

declarations.comments: Returns all the items preceding the current item in the array.
declarations.title: prec

declarations.comments: Returns the current item.
declarations.title: current

declarations.comments: Returns all the items succeeding the current item in the array.
declarations.title: succ

declarations.comments:
Returns the item immediately preceding the current item if it exists,
Nothing otherwise.
declarations.title: prev

declarations.comments:
Returns the item immediately succeeding the current item if it exists,
Nothing otherwise.
declarations.title: next

declarations.comments:
Performs a foldl using the provided functions to transform the items. The
`cur` function is used for the current item, and the `rest` function is
used for the other items.
declarations.title: foldlCurrent

declarations.comments:
Performs a foldr using the provided functions to transform the items. The
`cur` function is used for the current item, and the `rest` function is
used for the other items.
declarations.title: foldrCurrent

declarations.comments:
Performs a foldlWithIndex using the provided functions to transform the
items. The `cur` function is used for the current item, and the `rest`
function is used for the other items.
declarations.title: foldlWithIndexCurrent

declarations.comments:
Performs a foldrWithIndex using the provided functions to transform the
items. The `cur` function is used for the current item, and the `rest`
function is used for the other items.
declarations.title: foldrWithIndexCurrent

declarations.comments: Returns true if the current item is the head of the array, false otherwise.
declarations.title: atStart

declarations.comments:
Returns true if the current item is the last item in the array, false
otherwise.
declarations.title: atEnd

declarations.comments: Returns the index of the current item in the array.
declarations.title: curIndex

declarations.comments: Returns the number of items in the array.
declarations.title: length

declarations.comments: Focuses the head of the array.
declarations.title: goFirst

declarations.comments: Focuses the last item in the array.
declarations.title: goLast

declarations.comments:
Focuses the previous item in the array if it exists. Returns Nothing if
there is no item preceding the current item.
declarations.title: goPrev

declarations.comments:
Focuses the next item in the array if it exists. Returns Nothing if there
is no item succeeding the current item.
declarations.title: goNext

declarations.comments:
Performs a map, using the provided functions to transform the items. The
`cur` function is used for the current item, and the `rest` function is
used for the other items.
declarations.title: mapCurrent
